intro: Packera mancosana, commonly known as mountain sandwort, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Packera mancosana is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
